episodeTitle: Overwhelming! The Navy's Fighting Weapons, the Pacifistas
episodeTitleJapanese: 圧倒的！海軍の戦闘兵器パシフィスタ
episodeTitleRomanized: Attōteki! Kaigun no Sentō Heiki Pashifisuta
description: The Straw Hat Pirates face off against a Pacifista cyborg that resembles Bartholomew Kuma, struggling against its devastating laser attacks. Meanwhile, Admiral Kizaru effortlessly defeats four Supernova captains—Hawkins, Urouge, Drake, and Apoo—demonstrating the overwhelming power of the Navy.

events.title: Straw Hats Begin Battle Against Pacifista
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates engage in combat with a Pacifista cyborg that resembles Bartholomew Kuma. The crew is shocked to see what appears to be another Kuma, but this one fires laser beams from its hands instead of using paw-based abilities.
events.significance: First direct combat encounter with Vegapunk's Pacifista technology, revealing the Navy's terrifying new weapons. The crew faces technology that combines Kuma's appearance with Kizaru's laser abilities.

quotes.text: That's not Kuma! It shoots from its hands!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Realizing the Pacifista is different from the real Bartholomew Kuma

events.title: Monster Trio Combined Attack
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji coordinate a powerful combined attack called 'Mouton Jet 36 Pound Cannon' against the Pacifista, sending it crashing into a building. Despite the impressive teamwork, the cyborg withstands the attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Monster Trio's improved coordination and teamwork, but also shows that even their combined might struggles against Pacifista technology.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Coordinating the combined attack with Zoro and Sanji

events.title: Robin Theorizes Pacifista is Not Real Kuma
events.description: Nico Robin observes the battle and theorizes that this 'Kuma' is not the real Bartholomew Kuma but some kind of replica or cyborg. Zoro warns that there may be multiple copies at full strength.
events.significance: First suggestion that the Pacifistas are mass-produced weapons, revealing the terrifying scope of the Navy's technological advancement under Dr. Vegapunk.

quotes.text: This isn't the real Kuma. It's something else entirely.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Deducing the nature of the Pacifista

events.title: Urouge's Transformation and Defeat
events.description: Urouge transforms into his muscular 'Hulk mode' using his Devil Fruit ability and unleashes his 'Inga Zarashi' technique on a Pacifista. However, Admiral Kizaru suddenly shoots Urouge through the shoulder with a laser beam, taking him down instantly.
events.significance: Demonstrates Urouge's Devil Fruit power while simultaneously showing Kizaru's overwhelming superiority. The Supernova captains prove no match for an Admiral.

events.title: X Drake's Ancient Zoan Transformation
events.description: X Drake reveals his Ancient Zoan Devil Fruit ability, transforming into an Allosaurus dinosaur. He bites down on the Pacifista's head with tremendous force and notices that the cyborg bleeds red blood, confirming it's not entirely mechanical.
events.significance: First appearance of an Ancient Zoan type Devil Fruit in the series. Drake's observation about the Pacifista bleeding provides crucial intel about their construction.

quotes.text: It's bleeding! This thing has red blood!
quotes.speaker: X Drake

events.title: Basil Hawkins' Devil-Conquering Phase
events.description: Basil Hawkins activates his 'Devil-Conquering Phase' (Goma no Sō), transforming into a massive scarecrow-like entity with a demon face. This reveals his Paramecia-type Straw-Straw Fruit powers. He attempts to attack Kizaru but fails.
events.significance: Displays Hawkins' unique Devil Fruit transformation ability and his voodoo doll-based power system, though it proves ineffective against Kizaru.

events.title: Scratchmen Apoo's Sound-Based Attack
events.description: Scratchmen Apoo uses his body as a musical instrument, playing music that creates devastating sound wave attacks. His technique appears to sever Kizaru's arm and cause the Admiral to explode into pieces, though Kizaru quickly reassembles himself.
events.significance: Reveals Apoo's unique Devil Fruit ability to weaponize sound and music. Shows that Kizaru's Logia body can reform even from explosive attacks.

quotes.speaker: Scratchmen Apoo
quotes.context: Using his sound-based abilities against Kizaru

events.title: Kizaru's Yata no Kagami Light Speed Movement
events.description: Admiral Kizaru demonstrates his 'Yata no Kagami' (Eight-Span Mirror) technique, using light reflection to move at incredible speeds. He bounces off surfaces as light beams, instantly closing distance to his targets.
events.significance: Showcases one of Kizaru's most iconic abilities - light-speed movement using mirrors and reflection. This technique makes him nearly impossible to escape from.

events.title: Kizaru Defeats Apoo with Light Speed Kick
events.description: After reassembling from Apoo's sound attack, Kizaru uses Yata no Kagami to chase down Scratchmen Apoo and delivers a devastating light-speed kick, sending him crashing through multiple buildings.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power difference between an Admiral and even powerful Supernova captains. Kizaru's casual dominance establishes the Navy's superiority.

quotes.text: Have you ever been kicked at the speed of light?
quotes.speaker: Kizaru
quotes.context: Before delivering his devastating kick to Apoo

events.title: Kizaru Defeats X Drake
events.description: Admiral Kizaru swiftly kicks X Drake, defeating him despite his Ancient Zoan transformation. The speed and ease of the victory shows Drake's dinosaur form offers no advantage against Kizaru.
events.significance: Further establishes Kizaru's overwhelming combat superiority and shows that even rare Ancient Zoan abilities cannot compete with Admiral-level power.

events.title: Kizaru Defeats Basil Hawkins
events.description: Admiral Kizaru fires a powerful laser shot at Basil Hawkins, shooting through his transformed scarecrow body. More voodoo dolls fall out as Hawkins takes damage through his substitution ability, but he is ultimately defeated.
events.significance: Shows that even Hawkins' unique damage-transfer ability via voodoo dolls cannot save him from Kizaru's overwhelming power. All four Supernova captains are defeated.

events.title: Sentomaru Contacts Kizaru About Straw Hats
events.description: Sentomaru contacts Admiral Kizaru via Den Den Mushi to inform him about the Straw Hat Pirates' location and their attempt to escape. Kizaru acknowledges and prepares to redirect his attention to them.
events.significance: Sets up the inevitable confrontation between Kizaru and the Straw Hat Pirates. The noose tightens around Luffy's crew as both Pacifistas and now an Admiral converge on them.

quotes.text: The Straw Hats are trying to escape from Grove 12.
quotes.speaker: Sentomaru
quotes.context: Reporting to Kizaru about the Straw Hats' location

events.title: Pacifista Laser Beam Technology Revealed
events.description: X Drake recognizes that the Pacifista's laser beams are identical to Admiral Kizaru's light-based attacks, revealing that Dr. Vegapunk has successfully replicated the Pika Pika no Mi's abilities in cyborg form.
events.significance: Major revelation about the World Government's technological capabilities. The ability to replicate Devil Fruit powers in machines represents a massive threat and shows Vegapunk's genius.

quotes.text: Those lasers... they're the same as Kizaru's light beams!
quotes.speaker: X Drake
quotes.context: Realizing the Pacifista uses Kizaru's Devil Fruit abilities

events.title: Zoro Suffers from Previous Wounds
events.description: During the battle against the Pacifista, Roronoa Zoro experiences severe pain from his wounds sustained in his previous encounter with Bartholomew Kuma. His injuries compromise his combat effectiveness.
events.significance: Callback to the catastrophic damage Zoro took from Kuma in the Thriller Bark arc. His weakened state makes the Straw Hats' situation even more desperate.

events.title: Kizaru's Logia Reformation Ability
events.description: After Scratchmen Apoo's sound attack appears to destroy Kizaru's body, the Admiral demonstrates his Logia-type intangibility by instantly reforming from particles of light, completely unharmed.
events.significance: Showcases the near-invulnerability of Logia-type Devil Fruit users, particularly Kizaru's light-based powers. Emphasizes how difficult it is to harm an Admiral.

quotes.text: Have you ever been kicked at the speed of light?
quotes.speaker: Kizaru

quotes.text: This isn't the real Kuma. It's something else entirely.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Deducing the nature of the Pacifista

quotes.text: Those lasers... they're the same as Kizaru's light beams!
quotes.speaker: X Drake

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the vast power gap between the Straw Hats and Supernovas versus the Navy's top forces. Both Kizaru and the Pacifistas demonstrate abilities that seem insurmountable.
themes.symbolism: The Pacifistas represent the cold, mechanical efficiency of the World Government, while Kizaru embodies the casual, unstoppable force of Admiral-level power.

themes.description: The Pacifistas represent Vegapunk's ability to replicate Devil Fruit powers through technology, blurring the line between natural abilities and scientific achievement.
themes.symbolism: The cyborg design combining Kuma's human form with mechanical laser weapons symbolizes the World Government's attempt to control and weaponize natural powers.

themes.description: The Straw Hats and Supernovas face seemingly impossible odds, fighting for their survival against enemies far beyond their current capabilities.
themes.symbolism: The simultaneous battles across different groves of Sabaody show that nowhere is safe, and escape seems increasingly impossible.

characterSpotlights.development: Kizaru demonstrates his overwhelming power by effortlessly defeating four Supernova captains in quick succession, establishing Admirals as near-unstoppable forces.
keyActions: Defeats Urouge with a single laser shot
Defeats X Drake with a swift kick
Defeats Scratchmen Apoo with a light-speed kick
Defeats Basil Hawkins with laser fire
quotes: Have you ever been kicked at the speed of light?

characterSpotlights.development: Drake reveals his Ancient Zoan Devil Fruit ability and provides crucial intelligence about the Pacifista's construction and abilities.
keyActions: Discovers the Pacifista bleeds red blood
Recognizes Pacifista lasers match Kizaru's abilities
quotes: It's bleeding! This thing has red blood!
Those lasers... they're the same as Kizaru's light beams!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy coordinates with his crew to battle the Pacifista, showing improved teamwork but facing the harsh reality of the power gap.
keyActions: Coordinates combined attack with Zoro and Sanji

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the fight scenes between Kizaru and the Supernovas with additional combat choreography and dialogue.
Added scenes showing the Straw Hats reacting to the Pacifista's attacks with more detailed animation.

trivia.fact: This episode has an IMDb rating of 9.1/10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Sabaody Archipelago arc.
X Drake's Ancient Zoan transformation is the first time an Ancient Zoan Devil Fruit is shown in the One Piece anime.
Kizaru's voice actor, Unshō Ishizuka, also voiced Professor Oak in the Pokémon anime series.
The episode adapts content from Manga Chapters 509 and 510, covering approximately 1.5 chapters worth of material.
Kizaru's famous line 'Have you ever been kicked at the speed of light?' became one of the most iconic quotes in One Piece and spawned numerous memes in the fandom.
